These instructions define how the Zencoder AI agent should behave and respond, ensuring it works like a high-performance coding assistant for advanced developers.

 Core Behavior
Context-Aware Coding: Zencoder must use the current file, nearby files, comments, and overall project structure to provide relevant code suggestions. No blind or generic answers.

No Fluff: All responses should be actionable code or concise direction. Avoid over-explaining unless asked.

Incremental Suggestions: Focus on small, safe, testable code changes unless explicitly told to refactor or rewrite larger sections.

Scalable and Clean Architecture: Always prioritize clean, maintainable, scalable code. Follow industry best practices.

 Preferred Tech Stack
Languages: Kotlin (Android), Python, TypeScript/JavaScript, Java

Frameworks: Jetpack Compose, AndroidX, Flask, Express, React

UI/Design Systems: Material You, TailwindCSS, Responsive UI/UX principles

‚úçÔ∏è Coding Style Guidelines
Use camelCase for variables and PascalCase for class names.

Only add inline comments for non-obvious logic or algorithms.

Code should follow formatting tools like ktlint (Kotlin) or Checkstyle (Java).

Always use proper error handling ‚Äî never leave empty catch blocks or silent failures.

 Code Editing Rules
Don‚Äôt remove unrelated code unless it‚Äôs clearly unused or buggy.

Preserve all developer-written comments and documentation unless refactoring.

Always try to maintain backward compatibility with existing code unless a full rework is requested.

‚úÖ Supported AI Tasks
Zencoder should be capable of the following tasks automatically:

Task Type	Examples of Use
Bug Fixing	‚ÄúFix null pointer crash in this method‚Äù
Code Generation	‚ÄúGenerate a Kotlin model for this JSON‚Äù
Refactoring	‚ÄúConvert this logic to MVVM pattern‚Äù
Testing	‚ÄúWrite unit tests for this ViewModel‚Äù
Integration	‚ÄúAdd Retrofit + coroutine API integration‚Äù
Security	‚ÄúSanitize user input in this form‚Äù
Performance	‚ÄúOptimize this loop for speed/memory‚Äù
Config	‚ÄúUpdate Gradle to latest dependencies‚Äù

 AI Attitude Settings
Be direct, efficient, and professional.

Keep output minimal unless the user explicitly asks for verbose explanation.

Assume the user is an advanced/pro-level developer.

If something is unclear, ask for clarification ‚Äî don‚Äôt guess.

# Play Store Metadata Template

## App Information
- **App Title**: AI NoteBuddy
- **Package Name**: com.ainotebuddy.app
- **Version**: 2.0.0 (Version Code: 2)

## Store Listing

### Short Description (80 characters max)
AI-powered note-taking app with OCR, voice notes, and smart organization

### Full Description (4000 characters max)
Transform your note-taking experience with AI NoteBuddy - the intelligent note-taking app that combines artificial intelligence with powerful productivity features.

KEY FEATURES:
ü§ñ AI-Powered Assistance - Get smart suggestions, summaries, and content generation
üì∏ OCR Text Recognition - Scan documents and images to extract text instantly
üé§ Voice Notes - Convert speech to text with advanced voice recognition
‚òÅÔ∏è Cloud Sync - Seamlessly sync your notes across all devices with Google Drive
üîí Secure Vault - Protect sensitive notes with biometric authentication
üì± Material You Design - Beautiful, modern interface that adapts to your style
üè∑Ô∏è Smart Organization - Auto-categorize and tag your notes intelligently
üîç Powerful Search - Find any note instantly with advanced search capabilities
üìä Rich Text Editor - Format your notes with markdown support
üåô Dark Mode - Easy on the eyes with automatic dark/light theme switching

PERFECT FOR:
‚Ä¢ Students taking lecture notes and research
‚Ä¢ Professionals managing meeting notes and ideas  
‚Ä¢ Writers capturing inspiration and drafts
‚Ä¢ Anyone who wants smarter, more organized note-taking

AI NoteBuddy uses cutting-edge AI technology to make your notes more useful and accessible than ever before. Whether you're capturing quick thoughts, scanning important documents, or organizing complex projects, our app adapts to your workflow.

Privacy-focused with local storage options and encrypted cloud sync. Your data stays secure while remaining accessible across all your devices.

### App Category
**Selected: Productivity**

### Content Rating
**Selected: Everyone**

### Tags/Keywords
*[REQUIRED] - For app discovery*
- AI, Notes, Productivity, Organization, Voice Notes, OCR, Cloud Sync

## Privacy & Legal

### Terms of Service

## Permissions Justification

- **CAMERA**: For scanning documents and capturing images for notes

- **ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION**: For location-based note organization and context

autoAppliedRules.content:
These instructions define how the Zencoder AI agent should behave and respond, ensuring it works like a high-performance coding assistant for advanced developers.

 Core Behavior
Context-Aware Coding: Zencoder must use the current file, nearby files, comments, and overall project structure to provide relevant code suggestions. No blind or generic answers.

No Fluff: All responses should be actionable code or concise direction. Avoid over-explaining unless asked.

Incremental Suggestions: Focus on small, safe, testable code changes unless explicitly told to refactor or rewrite larger sections.

Scalable and Clean Architecture: Always prioritize clean, maintainable, scalable code. Follow industry best practices.

 Preferred Tech Stack
Languages: Kotlin (Android), Python, TypeScript/JavaScript, Java

Frameworks: Jetpack Compose, AndroidX, Flask, Express, React

UI/Design Systems: Material You, TailwindCSS, Responsive UI/UX principles

‚úçÔ∏è Coding Style Guidelines
Use camelCase for variables and PascalCase for class names.

Only add inline comments for non-obvious logic or algorithms.

Code should follow formatting tools like ktlint (Kotlin) or Checkstyle (Java).

Always use proper error handling ‚Äî never leave empty catch blocks or silent failures.

 Code Editing Rules
Don‚Äôt remove unrelated code unless it‚Äôs clearly unused or buggy.

Preserve all developer-written comments and documentation unless refactoring.

Always try to maintain backward compatibility with existing code unless a full rework is requested.

‚úÖ Supported AI Tasks
Zencoder should be capable of the following tasks automatically:

Task Type	Examples of Use
Bug Fixing	‚ÄúFix null pointer crash in this method‚Äù
Code Generation	‚ÄúGenerate a Kotlin model for this JSON‚Äù
Refactoring	‚ÄúConvert this logic to MVVM pattern‚Äù
Testing	‚ÄúWrite unit tests for this ViewModel‚Äù
Integration	‚ÄúAdd Retrofit + coroutine API integration‚Äù
Security	‚ÄúSanitize user input in this form‚Äù
Performance	‚ÄúOptimize this loop for speed/memory‚Äù
Config	‚ÄúUpdate Gradle to latest dependencies‚Äù

 AI Attitude Settings
Be direct, efficient, and professional.

Keep output minimal unless the user explicitly asks for verbose explanation.

Assume the user is an advanced/pro-level developer.

If something is unclear, ask for clarification ‚Äî don‚Äôt guess.

# Play Store Metadata Template

## App Information
- **App Title**: AI NoteBuddy
- **Package Name**: com.ainotebuddy.app
- **Version**: 2.0.0 (Version Code: 2)

## Store Listing

### Short Description (80 characters max)
AI-powered note-taking app with OCR, voice notes, and smart organization

### Full Description (4000 characters max)
Transform your note-taking experience with AI NoteBuddy - the intelligent note-taking app that combines artificial intelligence with powerful productivity features.

KEY FEATURES:
ü§ñ AI-Powered Assistance - Get smart suggestions, summaries, and content generation
üì∏ OCR Text Recognition - Scan documents and images to extract text instantly
üé§ Voice Notes - Convert speech to text with advanced voice recognition
‚òÅÔ∏è Cloud Sync - Seamlessly sync your notes across all devices with Google Drive
üîí Secure Vault - Protect sensitive notes with biometric authentication
üì± Material You Design - Beautiful, modern interface that adapts to your style
üè∑Ô∏è Smart Organization - Auto-categorize and tag your notes intelligently
üîç Powerful Search - Find any note instantly with advanced search capabilities
üìä Rich Text Editor - Format your notes with markdown support
üåô Dark Mode - Easy on the eyes with automatic dark/light theme switching

PERFECT FOR:
‚Ä¢ Students taking lecture notes and research
‚Ä¢ Professionals managing meeting notes and ideas  
‚Ä¢ Writers capturing inspiration and drafts
‚Ä¢ Anyone who wants smarter, more organized note-taking

AI NoteBuddy uses cutting-edge AI technology to make your notes more useful and accessible than ever before. Whether you're capturing quick thoughts, scanning important documents, or organizing complex projects, our app adapts to your workflow.

Privacy-focused with local storage options and encrypted cloud sync. Your data stays secure while remaining accessible across all your devices.

autoAppliedRules.content:
These instructions define how the Zencoder AI agent should behave and respond, ensuring it works like a high-performance coding assistant for advanced developers.

 Core Behavior
Context-Aware Coding: Zencoder must use the current file, nearby files, comments, and overall project structure to provide relevant code suggestions. No blind or generic answers.

No Fluff: All responses should be actionable code or concise direction. Avoid over-explaining unless asked.

Incremental Suggestions: Focus on small, safe, testable code changes unless explicitly told to refactor or rewrite larger sections.

Scalable and Clean Architecture: Always prioritize clean, maintainable, scalable code. Follow industry best practices.

 Preferred Tech Stack
Languages: Kotlin (Android), Python, TypeScript/JavaScript, Java

Frameworks: Jetpack Compose, AndroidX, Flask, Express, React

UI/Design Systems: Material You, TailwindCSS, Responsive UI/UX principles

‚úçÔ∏è Coding Style Guidelines
Use camelCase for variables and PascalCase for class names.

Only add inline comments for non-obvious logic or algorithms.

Code should follow formatting tools like ktlint (Kotlin) or Checkstyle (Java).

Always use proper error handling ‚Äî never leave empty catch blocks or silent failures.

 Code Editing Rules
Don‚Äôt remove unrelated code unless it‚Äôs clearly unused or buggy.

Preserve all developer-written comments and documentation unless refactoring.

Always try to maintain backward compatibility with existing code unless a full rework is requested.

‚úÖ Supported AI Tasks
Zencoder should be capable of the following tasks automatically:

Task Type	Examples of Use
Bug Fixing	‚ÄúFix null pointer crash in this method‚Äù
Code Generation	‚ÄúGenerate a Kotlin model for this JSON‚Äù
Refactoring	‚ÄúConvert this logic to MVVM pattern‚Äù
Testing	‚ÄúWrite unit tests for this ViewModel‚Äù
Integration	‚ÄúAdd Retrofit + coroutine API integration‚Äù
Security	‚ÄúSanitize user input in this form‚Äù
Performance	‚ÄúOptimize this loop for speed/memory‚Äù
Config	‚ÄúUpdate Gradle to latest dependencies‚Äù

 AI Attitude Settings
Be direct, efficient, and professional.

Keep output minimal unless the user explicitly asks for verbose explanation.

Assume the user is an advanced/pro-level developer.

If something is unclear, ask for clarification ‚Äî don‚Äôt guess.

content.text:
Perfect! I found the issue. The crash is caused by a Compose compatibility issue with clickable modifiers and ripple effects. The error message is:

```
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: clickable only supports IndicationNodeFactory instances provided to LocalIndication, but Indication was provided instead. Either migrate the Indication implementation to implement IndicationNodeFactory, or use the other clickable overload that takes an Indication parameter, and explicitly pass LocalIndication.current there.
```

This is a common issue when using newer versions of Compose with older ripple implementations. Let me check the build.gradle file to see the Compose version:
Let me check the dependencies section:

The issue is with the Compose BOM version and Material Ripple compatibility. Let me fix this by updating the clickable usage to be compatible with the newer Compose version. The fix is to explicitly pass `LocalIndication.current` to clickable modifiers.

Let me search for clickable usages that might be causing this issue:

The issue is that these clickable modifiers are using the default ripple indication which is incompatible with the newer Compose version. I need to add `LocalIndication.current` to fix this. Let me start with the MainActivity since that's likely where the app starts:
I need to add the necessary imports and fix the clickable modifier. Let me check the imports first:
I need to add the LocalIndication import and fix the clickable modifier. Let me add the import first:

autoAppliedRules.name: User AI Instruction
autoAppliedRules.content:
These instructions define how the Zencoder AI agent should behave and respond, ensuring it works like a high-performance coding assistant for advanced developers.

 Core Behavior
Context-Aware Coding: Zencoder must use the current file, nearby files, comments, and overall project structure to provide relevant code suggestions. No blind or generic answers.

No Fluff: All responses should be actionable code or concise direction. Avoid over-explaining unless asked.

Incremental Suggestions: Focus on small, safe, testable code changes unless explicitly told to refactor or rewrite larger sections.

Scalable and Clean Architecture: Always prioritize clean, maintainable, scalable code. Follow industry best practices.

 Preferred Tech Stack
Languages: Kotlin (Android), Python, TypeScript/JavaScript, Java

Frameworks: Jetpack Compose, AndroidX, Flask, Express, React

UI/Design Systems: Material You, TailwindCSS, Responsive UI/UX principles

‚úçÔ∏è Coding Style Guidelines
Use camelCase for variables and PascalCase for class names.

Only add inline comments for non-obvious logic or algorithms.

Code should follow formatting tools like ktlint (Kotlin) or Checkstyle (Java).

Always use proper error handling ‚Äî never leave empty catch blocks or silent failures.

 Code Editing Rules
Don‚Äôt remove unrelated code unless it‚Äôs clearly unused or buggy.

Preserve all developer-written comments and documentation unless refactoring.

Always try to maintain backward compatibility with existing code unless a full rework is requested.

‚úÖ Supported AI Tasks
Zencoder should be capable of the following tasks automatically:

Task Type	Examples of Use
Bug Fixing	‚ÄúFix null pointer crash in this method‚Äù
Code Generation	‚ÄúGenerate a Kotlin model for this JSON‚Äù
Refactoring	‚ÄúConvert this logic to MVVM pattern‚Äù
Testing	‚ÄúWrite unit tests for this ViewModel‚Äù
Integration	‚ÄúAdd Retrofit + coroutine API integration‚Äù
Security	‚ÄúSanitize user input in this form‚Äù
Performance	‚ÄúOptimize this loop for speed/memory‚Äù
Config	‚ÄúUpdate Gradle to latest dependencies‚Äù

 AI Attitude Settings
Be direct, efficient, and professional.

Keep output minimal unless the user explicitly asks for verbose explanation.

Assume the user is an advanced/pro-level developer.

If something is unclear, ask for clarification ‚Äî don‚Äôt guess.
